metadata.synopsis: The continuation of the LOW_BlushingMermaid_DisguisedHag dialogue when the hag drops her disgusie. Hag can offer the player
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Debugbook option "Act3 → LOW - Auntie Ethel's Revenge → Hag was defeated in Act I"- Attack Captain Grizly, she will transform into the Hag

104.speaker: Auntie Ethel
104.text: Yes, yes, I'm back, and would you look at me? Am I not glowing? I've decided I'm ready for the ultimate joy.
104.context: NodeContext: gesturing to herself, sassy, getting ready to reveal her big news

25.speaker: Auntie Ethel
25.context: NodeContext: hands on stomach, grinning horribly

51.speaker: Auntie Ethel
51.text: Here's the deal - I've swallowed little Vanra whole. Kill me, and the girl dies. And I'll simply return - stronger than ever.
51.context: NodeContext: eyes narrowed, evil smiles - knows she has the player cornered

28.speaker: Auntie Ethel
28.text: Here's the deal - I've swallowed little Vanra whole. Kill me, and the girl dies. And I'll simply return - stronger than ever.
28.context: NodeContext: eyes narrowed, evil smiles - knows she has the player cornered

7.speaker: Auntie Ethel
7.text: So run along, petal - and forget you ever saw me.
7.context: NodeContext: vicious smile, a little wave. She vanishes once the dialogue ends.

92.speaker: Auntie Ethel
92.context: NodeContext: her big reveal, she was the hag all along. Over the top and delighted.

34.speaker: Player
34.context: NodeContext: delighted and surprised - she can't believe the player actually killed vanra's mother for her

61.speaker: Auntie Ethel
61.text: I had it all worked out, you know. I was going to cut your pretty little head off, and then kill Lora myself.
61.context: NodeContext: delighted and surprised - she can't believe the player actually killed vanra's mother for her

37.speaker: Auntie Ethel
37.text: But then - you bashed the wretch's head in! So now, not only am I a-fumble, but I owe you, of all people, thanks.
37.context: NodeContext: delighted and surprised - she can't believe the player actually killed vanra's mother for her

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Lora was telling the truth? You took her child?

87.speaker: Auntie Ethel
87.text: Can't you tell, petal? I'm practically glowing.

59.speaker: Auntie Ethel
59.text: Still a little shit, I see.

80.speaker: Auntie Ethel
80.context: NodeContext: gritted teeth, pissed she has to thank the player. Nearly forcing every word out

44.speaker: Auntie Ethel
44.text: But now we're at an impasse. Vanra sits in my belly, growing fat with power. A fine hag she'll make, but I need time. I need to be left alone.
44.context: NodeContext: this is her big sales pitch, she NEEDS the player to fuck off and leave her.

73.speaker: Auntie Ethel
73.text: I know you're on a little crusade of your own, so let's come to a compromise, hm?
73.context: NodeContext: this is her big sales pitch, she NEEDS the player to fuck off and leave her.

63.speaker: Auntie Ethel
63.text: Walk away, petal. And when the time comes and your back is up against the wall, you'll have the guts and glory of a hag at your side. You'll have me.
63.context: NodeContext: vicious and delighted smile - she looks forward to killing people by the player's side. Gestures to herself dramatically on the last line.

71.speaker: Auntie Ethel
71.text: What about her? You killed her sweet mommy. I'm all she has left!

39.speaker: Auntie Ethel
39.text: I can give this girl a life of power. The life of a hag. So leave well enough alone, petal.

33.speaker: Player
33.context: NodeContext: enraged at how stupid the player is being - she has them beat, and she knows it.

75.speaker: Auntie Ethel
75.text: You stupid, brat. You can't win! Kill me, and Vanra dies. And I'll only return - stronger then ever!
75.context: NodeContext: enraged at how stupid the player is being - she has them beat, and she knows it.

43.speaker: Player
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hag should play "giving" animNodeContext: can't resist getting a dig in even when the player is doing what she says

66.speaker: Auntie Ethel
66.text: I knew you were smarter than you looked. Here, the gold as promised, plus a little extra for my favourite mommy-killer. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hag should play "giving" animNodeContext: can't resist getting a dig in even when the player is doing what she says

56.speaker: Auntie Ethel
56.text: Step a toe out of line, however? And the deal is off. Bye-bye, petal.

48.speaker: Player
48.context: NodeContext: gestures between herself and player, almost like they're dating.

64.speaker: Auntie Ethel
64.text: And you'll get it. But first we need to sort this out.
64.context: NodeContext: gestures between herself and player, almost like they're dating.

60.speaker: Auntie Ethel
60.text: Vanra sits in my belly, growing fat with power. A fine hag she'll make, but I need time. I need to be left alone.
60.context: NodeContext: this is her big sales pitch, she NEEDS the player to fuck off and leave her.

72.speaker: Auntie Ethel
72.text: Oh, lie to the others, but not to me, petal. You loved it - you murderous little shitbag.

5.speaker: Auntie Ethel
5.text: First things, first though - we need to figure this out.
5.context: NodeContext: gestures between herself and player, almost like they're dating.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I let you go once already, hag. Don't get in my way.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: The hells are you doing here?

67.speaker: Auntie Ethel
67.text: You wronged me, petal. Did you think I wouldn't find you? Wouldn't gut you?

85.speaker: Player
85.context: NodeContext: calm but also a little condescending

98.speaker: Auntie Ethel
98.text: Hold your horses. I came here to find you, petal, and cut your pretty little head off.
98.context: NodeContext: calm but also a little condescending

102.speaker: Auntie Ethel
102.text: But then you had to go and do me a good deed.
102.context: NodeContext: surprised but also grinning with delighted

70.speaker: Auntie Ethel
70.text: I didn't think you'd the stones to bash that wretch's head in! So now, not only am I a-fumble, but I owe you, of all people, thanks.
70.context: NodeContext: vicious and admiring of the player's cruelty - she can't believe the player actually killed vanra's mother for her

97.speaker: Auntie Ethel
97.text: *Sigh* I just can't have nice things, can I? And I was having such fun playing pirate captain.
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player can be anywhere in the building which is why there are no QNs for thisNodeContext: this is to cover the case in which the player has randomly attacked one the hag's redcaps and revealed her schemes. Dramatic, rolling eyes, sassy

103.speaker: Auntie Ethel
103.context: NodeContext: this is her big reveal, smug and delighted - can't wait to toy with the player

55.speaker: Player
55.context: NodeContext: cruel laugh - she's a hag. she has everything under control!

13.speaker: Auntie Ethel
13.text: Hah. Did you think you were the first? That I didn't plan for it, petal?
13.context: NodeContext: cruel laugh - she's a hag. she has everything under control!

42.speaker: Auntie Ethel
42.text: Mayrina ran off with the child I was promised - because of you. So I had to find myself a new one.
42.context: NodeContext: trying to shift the blame onto the player to make them feel bad - pure manipulation

6.speaker: Auntie Ethel
6.text: I lost Mayrina and the babe she promised me - because of you. So I had to find myself a new one.
6.context: NodeContext: trying to shift the blame onto the player to make them feel bad - pure manipulation

101.speaker: Auntie Ethel
101.text: And little Vanra was so very tasty.
101.context: NodeContext: cruel smile - the big reveal. She ATE the missing child.

0.speaker: Player
0.context: NodeContext: vicious smile, having a blast taunting the player

3.speaker: Auntie Ethel
3.text: Oh, petal - she'll thank me for it.
3.context: NodeContext: vicious smile, having a blast taunting the player

78.speaker: Auntie Ethel
78.text: Vanra sits in my belly - growing fat with power. In time, I'll vomit her up, and have myself a fresh young hag to train.
78.context: NodeContext: delighted in the horror of it all, cannot WAIT to have a hag to train

20.speaker: Auntie Ethel
20.text: I have you beat - so do the heroic thing.

107.speaker: Auntie Ethel
107.text: Unfortunately, that leaves me in a pickle. For while I'd love to rip your guts out, I shouldn't. Exertion is bad for the baby, you know.

49.speaker: Auntie Ethel
49.text: So - walk away. Walk away and let me a fine hag make.

88.speaker: Player
88.context: NodeContext: nonchalant shrug - she knows she has the player bear

77.speaker: Auntie Ethel
77.text: Or what? You'll kill me? Touch me, and the girl dies. And I'll simply return - stronger than ever.
77.context: NodeContext: nonchalant shrug - she knows she has the player bear

40.speaker: Auntie Ethel
40.text: Bah - a woman in my condition should be relaxing in the bath, not dealing with this nonsense.
40.context: NodeContext: throws hands in air, sick of the player

57.speaker: Auntie Ethel
57.text: I'll leave you to my crew, matey. And should you somehow survive? Stay away - or Vanra will suffer.

69.speaker: Player
69.context: NodeContext: appalled at the player's AUDACITY. Vicious in the second and third lines.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: No tricky offer for me, hag? No incentive?  I'm almost disappointed.
19.context: NodeContext: appalled at the player's AUDACITY. Vicious in the second and third lines.

86.speaker: Auntie Ethel
86.text: You want to negotiate? HAH. You lost that privilege when you killed me, you little shit. Stay and die - or walk away and live.
86.context: NodeContext: appalled at the player's AUDACITY. Vicious in the second and third lines.

4.speaker: Auntie Ethel
4.text: You want to negotiate? HAH. You lost that privilege when you humiliated me, you little shit. Stay and die - or walk away and live.
4.context: NodeContext: appalled at the player's AUDACITY. Vicious in the second and third lines.

30.speaker: Player
30.context: NodeContext: can't resist getting in a little dig before she leaves (lora is vanra's mother). Vicious in her delight

93.speaker: Auntie Ethel
93.text: Smartest thing you ever said, petal.
93.context: NodeContext: can't resist getting in a little dig before she leaves (lora is vanra's mother). Vicious in her delight

41.speaker: Player
41.context: NodeContext: can't resist getting in a little dig before she leaves (lora is vanra's mother). Vicious in her delight

65.speaker: Auntie Ethel
65.text: Smartest thing you ever said, petal. Oh, and give Lora my love, won't you? Bye-bye now.
65.context: NodeContext: can't resist getting in a little dig before she leaves (lora is vanra's mother). Vicious in her delight

17.speaker: Player
17.text: What an awful way to die.
17.context: NodeContext: mock appalled, dramatic - like she'd ever DO such an evil thing

96.speaker: Auntie Ethel
96.text: Oh, she's not dead, petal. Like I'd kill a sweet innocent child.
96.context: NodeContext: mock appalled, dramatic - like she'd ever DO such an evil thing

2.speaker: Player
2.context: NodeContext: gesturing proudly to pregnant stomach - showing it off with delight

35.speaker: Auntie Ethel
35.text: I'm already showing - doesn't it suit me so well?
35.context: NodeContext: gesturing proudly to pregnant stomach - showing it off with delight

90.speaker: Player
90.text: That's so evil, even I'm impressed.

89.speaker: Auntie Ethel
89.text: Aww, thank you petal. She barely even cried when I swallowed her whole - such a good little thing.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I let you go once already, hag. Don't get in my way.
22.context: NodeContext: vicious and cruel - wants to kill the player

18.speaker: Auntie Ethel
18.text: You made a mockery of me, you little shit - besting me in my own home. Did you think I would simply walk away?
18.context: NodeContext: vicious and cruel - wants to kill the player

36.speaker: Player
36.text: The hells are you doing here?
36.context: NodeContext: holding up a hand (maybe a finger?) to stop the player, like you would a dog.

16.speaker: Player
16.context: NodeContext: holding up a hand (maybe a finger?) to stop the player, like you would a dog.

106.speaker: Auntie Ethel
106.context: NodeContext: holding up a hand (maybe a finger?) to stop the player, like you would a dog.

38.speaker: Auntie Ethel
38.text: You wouldn't hurt a pregnant woman, would you?
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: hands on bellyNodeContext: hands on belly, a vicious smile

105.speaker: Auntie Ethel
105.text: Little Vanra was so very tasty - I'd hate for her to go to waste.
105.context: NodeContext: vicious smile - the big reveal. She ATE the missing child

110.speaker: Auntie Ethel
110.text: Now, now, petal - that wasn't very polite.
110.context: NodeContext: condescending, dramatic (player attacked her for no reason while she was in her human disguise_

29.speaker: Player
29.context: NodeContext: over the top, really overacting (she's getting ready to reveal she's pregnant)

95.speaker: Auntie Ethel
95.text: That said, I'm shocked and appalled, petal - I can't believe you'd try to gut me out in the open like that!
95.context: NodeContext: over the top, really overacting (she's getting ready to reveal she's pregnant)

79.speaker: Auntie Ethel
79.text: After all, it's not just me anymore. I'm - what is it they say? Eating for two.
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Places her hands on her pregnant stomachNodeContext: cruel, delighted. Places her hands on her stomach for emphasis - big reveal that she's pregnant

100.speaker: Player
100.context: NodeContext: gestures to herself from head to toe, delighted by the player's reaction

81.speaker: Auntie Ethel
81.text: Aye - gobbled myself up a sweet little girl. And she was so very tasty.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: How are you back? I killed you!
109.context: NodeContext: gestures to herself from head to toe, delighted by the player's reaction

9.speaker: Player
9.context: NodeContext: gestures to herself from head to toe, delighted by the player's reaction

68.speaker: Auntie Ethel
68.text: See for yourself, petal! Am I not glowing?
68.context: NodeContext: gestures to herself from head to toe, delighted by the player's reaction

26.speaker: Auntie Ethel
26.text: Because the precious, sweet little girl I ate? She's still alive.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I let you go once already, hag. Don't get in my way.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I knew something was off about you.

54.speaker: Auntie Ethel
54.text: And here I thought my acting was flawless.
